headline: AppLovin Stock Rides Wave of Price-Target Hikes to a Record High
summary: Matthew Cost of  Morgan Stanley  raised his call on shares of the digital ad company by 56% to $750 on Monday, helping lift the stock to a record $745.61 in early trading.  Eleven other firms have raised their targets on the stock since August, including Piper Sandler and UBS on Friday.  Analysts are upbeat about AppLovin’s prospects, projecting long-term earnings growth of 34% on average, according to FactSet.

Analysts are upbeat about AppLovin’s prospects, projecting long-term earnings growth of 34% on average, according to FactSet.

headline: Applovin, furniture stocks, MoonLake: Trending Tickers
summary: Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman tracks several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Applovin (APP) shares hitting a record high; the mixed reaction from furniture stocks Wayfair (W), RH (RH), and Floor & Decor (FND) as President Trump threatens tariffs on furniture imports; and MoonLake Immunotherapeutics (MLTX) sinking by nearly 90% in response to weak data from an experimental drug trial. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Oppenheimer Lifts Applovin Corp (APP) Price Target on Booming Non-Gaming Advertising
summary: AppLovin Corp (NASDAQ:APP) is one of the best growth stocks to buy and hold forever. On September 23, analysts at Oppenheimer raised the stock’s price target by $240 to $740, while reiterating an ‘Outperform’ rating. The significant price target hike underscores the research firm’s confidence in the company’s non-gaming advertising and long-term growth drivers. AppLovin […]
